name: vic_govt_dhhs_lga_profiles_2015
title: Local Government Area (LGA) profiles data 2015 for VIC

legal.attribution: Government of Victoria - Department of Health and Human Services; accessed from SUDO on {dateOfAccess}.
legal.licenceType: Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Australia (CC BY 3.0 AU)

keyword: local government area, lga, statistical, profiles, planning, victoria, population, diversity, disadvantage, social engagement, housing, transport, education, health, service, child, family
abstract: The 2015 profiles (released November 2016) include over 220 variables from a wide range of data sources. The profiles provide measures on a broad range of topics including: population, diversity, disadvantage and social engagement, housing, transport and education, health status and service utilisation, child and family characteristics and service utilisation. Rankings are provided to enable comparison of LGAs, along with the Victorian averages. The profiles are structured to provide a measure on each variable for each Local Government Area (LGA), and to also enable comparisons by providing rankings against all Local Government Areas as well as the Victorian measure. Profiles are also provided for former Department of Health regions, as well as the former Department of Human Services operational service areas and divisions. Note that all data is the most current available at the time of publication. Based on the Australian Statistical Geography Standard (ASGS), Non ABS Structures, 2015 (note, according to the ABS website LGA boundaries have not changed since 2014).

selectedAttributes.name: ppl_reporting_heart_disease_perc
selectedAttributes.title: Percent of people reporting heart disease (2011)
selectedAttributes.description: The percentage of people who reported they have been told by a doctor that they have heart disease. Source: Victorian Population Health Survey, Department of Health and Human Services. Currency: 2011.

selectedAttributes.name: ppl_reporting_osteoporosis_perc
selectedAttributes.title: Percent of people reporting osteoporosis (2011)
selectedAttributes.description: The percentage of people who reported they have been told by a doctor they have osteoporosis, or thin and weak bones that may break easily. Source: Victorian Population Health Survey, Department of Health and Human Services. Currency: 2011.

selectedAttributes.name: ppl_reporting_arthritis_rank
selectedAttributes.title: People reporting arthritis (ranked on percentage) (2011)
selectedAttributes.description: LGA ranking of the percentage of people who reported they have been told by a doctor they have arthritis. Source: Victorian Population Health Survey, Department of Health and Human Services. Currency: 2011.
